column2: Halsbury, Volume  11  Pages 85  and  86,  Simonds Edition:- "The grant
of a Writ is as  a general Rule, a matter of discretion of the Court.  It is not an

column1: order  granted  as  of  a  right  and
column4: issued  as  a  matter  of  course.

column2: Accordingly,  the  Court  may refuse  the  order,  not  only  upon  the  merits  but
also  by reason of the special circumstances of the case (Halsbury's  Laws of
